message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken

<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.util.*;
import java.io.*;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(br.readLine());
        int a = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        int b = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        System.out.println(a + b);
    }
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: 
In this Java program template for Codeforces, we first import necessary classes. We create a main class named 'Main'. Inside the main method, we create a BufferedReader object 'br' that will help us to read the input from the user. 

Then, we create a StringTokenizer object 'st'. This object breaks the input string into tokens. We use the method 'nextToken()' of StringTokenizer to get the next token from the string. In this case, we are reading two integers from the user, so we call 'nextToken()' twice. 

We parse these tokens into integers using 'Integer.parseInt()' and store them in variables 'a' and 'b'. Finally, we print the sum of these two integers. 

This is a basic template and you can modify it according to the problem statement of the competition.
